title: Man City 'to demand £100m' from Bayern Munich for Gabriel Jesus
text:

Manchester City have slapped a £100m price tag on Gabriel Jesus as Bayern Munich prepare to swoop for the striker.

Jesus has played second fiddle to Sergio Aguero for much of time at the Etihad since signing for City in 2016.

The 22-year-old Brazilian was preferred to Aguero for the 3-0 win over Aston Villa on Saturday, but it was only his fourth Premier League start of the season.

However, Guardiola has always maintained that he rates Jesus highly and sees him as the long-term successor to 31-year-old Aguero.

And that is why City chiefs will tell suitors that Jesus will not be leaving City either in January or next summer.

(Image: Getty Images)

However, Guardiola's insistence that Jesus is part of his plans has not put off German giants Bayern Munich, who are ready to swoop for the striker, according to The Sun .

The Bundesliga champions spent all summer chasing £90million-rated winger Leroy Sane, until a cruciate knee ligament injury ruled him out until February.

But the Sun says Bayern's interest in Jesus will lead City to declare they will accept no less than £100m for the striker.

That is almost four times the £28m they paid Brazilian club Palmeiras for his services four years ago.

(Image: Getty Images)

City's win over Villa on Saturday sent Guardiola's side back to second in the Premier League and closed the gap on Liverpool to three points ahead of the leaders' clash with Tottenham on Sunday.

But it took a second-half rout to secure the points after the teams went in level at half-time.

Guardiola said after the game : "I am not concerned about the table. I am concerned about the way we played.

"If we play the level we played in the second half we will be there at the end of the season. If we play the way we did in the first half, we will be relegated."
description: City reckon Brazilian striker's value has quadrupled with Guardiola viewing him as Aguero's successor
